column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Five Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Tuesday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 698 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Northern Ireland on Tuesday
column5: 457 on Monday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.There are 429 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals
column7: up from 412 on Monday.There are 35 patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units
column8: down from 37 on Monday.Last updated 16 November at 14:10 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
column10: 525 vaccines for Covid-19 have been administered in Northern Ireland as of Tuesday.Last updated 16 November at 14:15 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandAnother 4
column11: 449 cases of coronavirus were reported in the Republic of Ireland on Tuesday
column13: 570 on Monday. The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
column16: is updated weekly and includes "probable and possible" Covid-19-linked deaths.There are 614 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals.There and 114 patients with Covid-19 are in hospital intensive care units.Last updated 16 November at 14:50 local timeSource: Department of Health IrelandA total of 7
column17: 368.836 vaccines for Covid-19 had been administered in the Republic of Ireland as of Monday.A total of 3
column19: 553 people have had their first dose and 3
column21: 995 have had their second dose.Last updated 16 November at 14:50 local timeSource: Department of Health Ireland
